    • Method Detail

      • nextChar

        public char nextChar()
              throws org.apache.james.protocols.imap.DecodingException
        Reads the next character in the current line. This method will continue to return the same character until the ImapRequestLineReader.consume() method is called.
        Specified by:
        nextChar in class org.apache.james.imap.decode.ImapRequestLineReader
        Returns:
        The next character TODO: character encoding is variable and cannot be determine at the token level; this char is not accurate reported; should be an octet
        Throws:
        org.apache.james.protocols.imap.DecodingException - If the end-of-stream is reached.

      • read

        public InputStream read(int size,
               boolean extraCRLF)
                 throws org.apache.james.protocols.imap.DecodingException
        Reads and consumes a number of characters from the underlying reader, filling the char array provided. TODO: remove unnecessary copying of bits; line reader should maintain an internal ByteBuffer;
        Specified by:
        read in class org.apache.james.imap.decode.ImapRequestLineReader
        Parameters:
        size - number of characters to read and consume
        extraCRLF - Add extra CRLF
        Throws:
        org.apache.james.protocols.imap.DecodingException - If a char can't be read into each array element.
